description:
The pay range is $87,900.00 - $158,200.00

Pay is based on several factors which vary based on position. These include labor markets and in some instances may include education, work experience and certifications. In addition to your pay, Target cares about and invests in you as a team member, so that you can take care of yourself and your family. Target offers eligible team members and their dependents comprehensive health benefits and programs, which may include medical, vision, dental, life insurance and more, to help you and your family take care of your whole selves. Other benefits for eligible team members include 401(k), employee discount, short term disability, long term disability, paid sick leave, paid national holidays, and paid vacation. Find competitive benefits from financial and education to well-being and beyond at .

L6 Sr. Marketing Manager (Long Term Designer and Brand Partnerships)

Hybrid-Mpls.

About us:

Working at Target means helping all families discover the joy of everyday life. We bring that vision to life through our values and culture. Learn more about Target here .

Working within Guest Marketing Strategy , you will lead the development of guest-centric, culturally relevant marketing strategies and plans that drive demand for the business, improve equity perceptions with our guest and build the Target brand. You will work cross functionally with external partnerships, marketing, merchandising and enterprise partners to bring strategic objectives to life across a marketing mix and experience touchpoints. Your commitment to partnership and collaboration will rally external and internal partners across functions to ensure alignment and progress towards common outcomes. As a Sr. Manager, Guest Marketing Strategy , you will lead a team of Marketers, manage external partnerships, leverage your strong leadership, strategic thinking, and analytical skills to deliver guest marketing strategy, investment, and marketing driven business outcomes. This role requires strong organizational, strategic, and creative thinking skills, partnership management and enterprise leadership. Your ability to bring external and internal teams together to define future ways of working will enable smart innovation and learning for the full team.

Core responsibilities of this job are described within this job description. Job duties may change at any time due to business needs.
• Accountable for driving marketing performance for external long term designer partner/brands and contribute to enterprise outcomes
• Leads external long term designer partner/brand partnership management, planning and connections, inclusive of holistic marketing plans across Marketing, Digital, PR & other enterprise partners
• Understand external long term designer partner/brand, business/category, guest, trend & cultural landscape, competitive environment and financial goals and translate to build effective marketing strategies, using data, insights, and key learnings to inform decision-making and continuous improvement
• Cultivates and nurtures strong partnerships and effectively collaborates to drive outcomes with external long term designer partner/brand and enterprise teams across Marketing & Digital, Merchandising, and cross-functional partners
• Anticipates risks and opportunities to meeting outcomes, and ensures external designer long term partner/brand and cross-functional leader alignment on deliverables
• Represents Marketing & Digital with key external and internal business partners
• Responsibilities may also include key initiatives such as contract negotiations, long range partnership planning and corporate social responsibility activations

About you: Four-year degree or equivalent experience
• 8+ years of related work experience, designer partnership and/or retail/brand experience a plus
• Strong communication and interpersonal skills with the ability to navigate organizational complexity, influence others & collaborate across external and internal partners, functions and leadership levels
• Strong strategic and creative thought-leadership with ability to distill information & develop a compelling narrative tailored to your audience
• Strong communication and interpersonal skills with the ability to navigate organizational complexity, influence others & collaborate across external and internal partners, functions and leadership levels
• Deep industry knowledge and acumen
• Self-starter with ability to work in a fast-paced environment and manage partnership & project
• Ability to lead & inspire agency/creative partners
• Demonstrated curiosity & a passion for leading through ambiguity to solve complex challenges and dynamic situations

Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA)

Target will provide reasonable accommodations with the application process upon your request as required to comply with applicable laws. If you have a disability and require assistance in this application process, please visit your nearest Target store or Supply Chain Facility or reach out to Guest Services at Show phone number for additional information.
